a1: JSON Schema is a vocabulary that allows you to annotate and validate JSON documents. It describes the structure, types, and constraints of your data.
a2: The tool examines each value in your JSON to determine its type (string, number, integer, boolean, null, array, or object). For arrays, it infers the item type from the first element.
q3: Which JSON Schema version is used?
a3: The generated schema uses JSON Schema draft 2020-12, the latest specification.
q4: Can I validate JSON against the generated schema?
a4: The generated schema can be used with any JSON Schema validator library in your preferred programming language.
